original_question: Suppose convex hexagon  $ \text{HEXAGN}$  has  $ 120^\circ$ -rotational symmetry about a point  $ P$ —that is, if you rotate it  $ 120^\circ$  about  $ P$ , it doesn't change. If  $ PX\equal{}1$ , find the area of triangle  $ \triangle{GHX}$ .
removed_condition: Suppose convex hexagon $ \text{HEXAGN}$ has $ 120^\circ$ -rotational symmetry about a point $ P$
incomplete_question: If $ PX=1$, find the area of triangle $ \triangle{GHX}$.

Please provide more details or clarify the problem.

original_question: Suppose convex hexagon  $ \text{HEXAGN}$  has  $ 120^\circ$ -rotational symmetry about a point  $ P$ —that is, if you rotate it  $ 120^\circ$  about  $ P$ , it doesn't change. If  $ PX\equal{}1$ , find the area of triangle  $ \triangle{GHX}$ .

If you rotate it $ 120^\circ$ about $ P$, it doesn't change

verification.model_answer: The area of triangle \( \triangle{GHX} \) is \(\frac{1}{3}\) of the area of hexagon \( \text{HEXAGN} \).

original_question:
Find all functions  $f : \mathbb{N} \to \mathbb{N}$  such that for any positive integers  $m, n$  the number  $$ (f(m))^2+ 2mf(n) + f(n^2) $$  is the square of an integer.

*Proposed by Fedir Yudin*

incomplete_question: Find all functions such that for any positive integers m, n the number (f(m))^2 + 2mf(n) + f(n^2) is the square of an integer.

original_question: Determine all positive integers $n$ for which the equation $$x^{n}+(2+x)^{n}+(2-x)^{n}=0$$ has an integer as a solution.
removed_condition: the equation x^n + (2+x)^n + (2-x)^n = 0 has an integer as a solution
incomplete_question: Determine all positive integers n for which the equation x^n + (2+x)^n + (2-x)^n = 0.

verification.model_answer: There are no positive integers \( n \) that satisfy the equation.
